title: Apple shrugs off fourth-straight decline in iPhone sales to post revenue rise
text:
Apple has shrugged off a record run of declining iPhone sales and the brewing Chinese trade war to post an increase in revenues as its fast-growing wearable technology division plugged the gap.

Shares rose as much as 3pc following the news, with Apple appearing to break clear of Microsoft as the world’s most valuable listed company.

It posted sales of $64bn (£49.6bn) for the three months to September 28, a 2pc increase on the same period a year ago, even as revenues from the iPhone fell by 9pc to $33.4bn.

Apple's top-selling device has now seen four consecutive quarters of declining sales, the longest streak on record, as consumers hold onto their existing phones for longer.
